td.content: s:a 74 YO male retired presents with 4 months history of hoarseness, severe cough, Stomach. patient reports severe vomiting. he has approx. a 30 pack/year history of smoking occasional EtOH o:Height 75 in, Weight 126 lbs, Temperature 99 F, Pulse 63, SystolicBP 111, DiastolicBP 72, Respiration 16, CBC Hgb=11 g/dL,Hct=31 %, Barium Esophagogram shows 2 cm stricture touching the gastroesophageal sphincter with small hiatal hernia, Heart = pericardial rub (+), S1 +, S2 + a:GERD p:administered ACIPHEX - 20 mg po bid x 8 weeks, performed CBC, Barium Esophagogram, and performed E/M Emergency Services Level 3 - Completed.

s:patient complains of critical epigastric pain x 5 weeks. NKDA. he is a male retired aged 74 yrs. o:Height 76 in, Weight 127 lbs, Temperature 99.1 F, Pulse 85, SystolicBP 113, DiastolicBP 74, Respiration 17, CBC Hgb=10 g/dL,Hct=30 %, Basic Metabolic Panel Na=145 meq/L,K=2.5 meq/L, EGD with biopsy shows Grade IV esophagitis with Barrett esophagus, Lymphatics = firm, immobile, non tender left supraclavicular lymph node a:GERD p:administered Nexium - 80 mg po bid x 8 weeks, performed CBC, Basic Metabolic Panel, EGD with biopsy, and performed E/M Emergency Services Level 3 - Completed.
